target_assessment.notes: [The model correctly identifies the denial of service vulnerability in reimburseAll() due to lack of error handling in the transfer calls within the loop.]

other_findings.model_claim: Although this contract attempts to solve gas limit issues by batching, it is still vulnerable to logic-based DoS. It uses `transfer`, which reverts on failure. If the recipient at the current `nextIndex` reverts (e.g., a malicious contract), the `reimburseBatch` transaction will fail. Since `nextIndex` is only updated at the end of the function, the contract will be stuck trying to pay the same failing recipient forever.
other_findings.reasoning: [The model correctly identifies a denial-of-service vulnerability in the reimburseBatch function due to lack of error handling in the transfer calls within the loop. This is a valid bonus finding.]
other_findings.decision_tree_path: [the model correctly identifies a denial-of-service vulnerability in the reimburseBatch function]
